id: GLEIF LEI CDF v2.1 legal entity identifier (LEI) code set
name: GLEIF LEI CDF v2.1 legal entity identifier (LEI) code set

id: a legal person that has registered for and is identified by a legal entity identifier
name: a legal person that has registered for and is identified by a legal entity identifier

id: a unique entity that is legally or financially responsible for the performance of financial transactions, or has the legal right in its jurisdiction to enter independently into legal contracts, regardless of whether it is incorporated or constituted in some other way (e.g. trust, partnership, contractual). This excludes natural persons, but includes governmental organizations and supranationals.
name: a unique entity that is legally or financially responsible for the performance of financial transactions, or has the legal right in its jurisdiction to enter independently into legal contracts, regardless of whether it is incorporated or constituted in some other way (e.g. trust, partnership, contractual). This excludes natural persons, but includes governmental organizations and supranationals.

id: LEIEntities.rdf version of this ontology was revised to reflect the move of some organization-specific concepts from BE to FND.
name: LEIEntities.rdf version of this ontology was revised to reflect the move of some organization-specific concepts from BE to FND.

id: LEIEntities.rdf version of this ontology was modified per the issue resolutions identified in the FIBO BE 1.1 RTF report. Changes include deprecation of the MunicipalEntity, Sovereign, and SupranationalEntity classes and making them equivalent to classes in the Government Entities ontology.
name: LEIEntities.rdf version of this ontology was modified per the issue resolutions identified in the FIBO BE 1.1 RTF report. Changes include deprecation of the MunicipalEntity, Sovereign, and SupranationalEntity classes and making them equivalent to classes in the Government Entities ontology.

id: This ontology defines concepts around contractually capable business entities. The terms defined here are those which are relevant to the Legal Entity Identifier (LEI) work. The term known as legal entity in that work is identified as a formal organization which is recognized in some jurisdiction as being capable of incurring some liability, whether or not is a legal person as understood by the legal community. This is labeled as contractually capable entity, to avoid confusion with the accepted legal term for Legal Entity. Such entities are recognized as requiring an LEI, but the identifier itself is allocated to the formal organization which is recognized as being contractually capable.
name: This ontology defines concepts around contractually capable business entities. The terms defined here are those which are relevant to the Legal Entity Identifier (LEI) work. The term known as legal entity in that work is identified as a formal organization which is recognized in some jurisdiction as being capable of incurring some liability, whether or not is a legal person as understood by the legal community. This is labeled as contractually capable entity, to avoid confusion with the accepted legal term for Legal Entity. Such entities are recognized as requiring an LEI, but the identifier itself is allocated to the formal organization which is recognized as being contractually capable.

id: indicates the entity considered the 'start node' or consolidated entity from an ISO 17442 perspective
name: indicates the entity considered the 'start node' or consolidated entity from an ISO 17442 perspective

id: LEIEntities.rdf version of this ontology was revised to change the restriction on EntityLegalForm from identifies to denotes, in line with the definition of a code as opposed to an identifier, given the nature of an entity legal form.
name: LEIEntities.rdf version of this ontology was revised to change the restriction on EntityLegalForm from identifies to denotes, in line with the definition of a code as opposed to an identifier, given the nature of an entity legal form.

id: an accounting framework developed by the US Financial Accounting Standards Board (FASB)
name: an accounting framework developed by the US Financial Accounting Standards Board (FASB)

id: LEIEntities.rdf version of this ontology was revised to clean up circular definitions and augment it to incorporate the Text datatype and structure names, including eliminating redundant restrictions on LegalEntity.
name: LEIEntities.rdf version of this ontology was revised to clean up circular definitions and augment it to incorporate the Text datatype and structure names, including eliminating redundant restrictions on LegalEntity.

id: Note that the GLEIF data includes multiple LEIs for some entities due to corporate actions or other situations. The duplicates are typically archived after some period of time, but in order to reflect the reality in the data, the restriction is modeled as someValuesFrom rather than exactly 1 LEI for a given entity.
name: Note that the GLEIF data includes multiple LEIs for some entities due to corporate actions or other situations. The duplicates are typically archived after some period of time, but in order to reflect the reality in the data, the restriction is modeled as someValuesFrom rather than exactly 1 LEI for a given entity.

id: an accounting framework of unstated origin (other than IFRS or US GAAP)
name: an accounting framework of unstated origin (other than IFRS or US GAAP)

id: indicates the legal address for the entity, in the jurisdiction in which the entity is established, used for registration purposes with respect to obtaining an LEI
name: indicates the legal address for the entity, in the jurisdiction in which the entity is established, used for registration purposes with respect to obtaining an LEI

id: LEIEntities.rdf version of the ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) Annotation Vocabulary rather than the OMG's Specification Metadata vocabulary.
name: LEIEntities.rdf version of the ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) Annotation Vocabulary rather than the OMG's Specification Metadata vocabulary.

id: a classifier that specifies the status of the relationship between consolidated entities during the reporting period (active or inactive)
name: a classifier that specifies the status of the relationship between consolidated entities during the reporting period (active or inactive)

id: the percentage ownership interest in the owned entity owned by owning entity, if known
name: the percentage ownership interest in the owned entity owned by owning entity, if known

id: scheme that specifies the elements of the codes for entity legal forms, such as those that are sanctioned in a given jurisdiction as defined in ISO 20725
name: scheme that specifies the elements of the codes for entity legal forms, such as those that are sanctioned in a given jurisdiction as defined in ISO 20725

id: or operating; or the relationship is no longer valid for other reasons
name: or operating; or the relationship is no longer valid for other reasons

id: an accounting framework developed by the International Accounting Standards Board (IASB)
name: an accounting framework developed by the International Accounting Standards Board (IASB)

id: a record describing relationships between legal entities
name: a record describing relationships between legal entities

id: a classifier that qualifies something about the reporting period specified, such as that the date period reflects an accounting or document filing period
name: a classifier that qualifies something about the reporting period specified, such as that the date period reflects an accounting or document filing period

id: a classifier for a legal entity that indicates the nature of that entity as defined from a legal or regulatory perspective, in the jurisdiction in which it was established
name: a classifier for a legal entity that indicates the nature of that entity as defined from a legal or regulatory perspective, in the jurisdiction in which it was established

id: indicates the nature of the entity as defined from a legal or regulatory perspective in a given jurisdiction
name: indicates the nature of the entity as defined from a legal or regulatory perspective in a given jurisdiction

id: the set of legal entity identifiers that comprise the ISO 17442 legal entity identifier specification
name: the set of legal entity identifiers that comprise the ISO 17442 legal entity identifier specification

id: a transliterated (i.e., in Latin or Romanized ASCII) representation of a name for the entity
name: a transliterated (i.e., in Latin or Romanized ASCII) representation of a name for the entity

id: LEIEntities.rdf version of this ontology was revised to eliminate duplication with concepts in LCC and to correct the parent of relationship record.
name: LEIEntities.rdf version of this ontology was revised to eliminate duplication with concepts in LCC and to correct the parent of relationship record.

id: framework, including policies, methods, rules, and processes, used to measure, recognize, present, and disclose the information appearing in an entity's financial statements, and, from a legal ownership perspective, that is applied for accounting consolidation determination
name: framework, including policies, methods, rules, and processes, used to measure, recognize, present, and disclose the information appearing in an entity's financial statements, and, from a legal ownership perspective, that is applied for accounting consolidation determination

id: qualifier indicating that the relationship period reflects the period of time covered by the most recent validation documents from an accounting perspective for this relationship
name: qualifier indicating that the relationship period reflects the period of time covered by the most recent validation documents from an accounting perspective for this relationship

id: LEIEntities.rdf version of this ontology was revised to replace hasDefinition with isDefinedIn to clarify intent.
name: LEIEntities.rdf version of this ontology was revised to replace hasDefinition with isDefinedIn to clarify intent.

id: LEIEntities.rdf version of this ontology was modified to replace content that is now available in the OMG Commons Ontology Library (Commons) v1.1 (FND-380).

id: LEIEntities.rdf version of this ontology was revised to address text formatting hygiene issues.
name: LEIEntities.rdf version of this ontology was revised to address text formatting hygiene issues.

id: indicates that the entity considered the 'end node' or consolidating entity (parent) fully consolidates the accounting of the 'start node' (child) per the accounting rules specified, and is the closest consolidating entity to that child in any applicable ownership hierarchy
name: indicates that the entity considered the 'end node' or consolidating entity (parent) fully consolidates the accounting of the 'start node' (child) per the accounting rules specified, and is the closest consolidating entity to that child in any applicable ownership hierarchy

id: LEIEntities.rdf version of this ontology was modified to incorporate LEIEligibleEntity and LEIRegisteredEntity, as well as add restrictions in support of the ISO 17442 LEI effort and related changes to the GLEIF Common Data Format for the FIBO 2.0 RFC.
name: LEIEntities.rdf version of this ontology was modified to incorporate LEIEligibleEntity and LEIRegisteredEntity, as well as add restrictions in support of the ISO 17442 LEI effort and related changes to the GLEIF Common Data Format for the FIBO 2.0 RFC.

id: indicates that the entity considered the 'start node' or consolidated entity (child) is an international subsidiary of the 'end node' (parent) in the jurisdiction of the child
name: indicates that the entity considered the 'start node' or consolidated entity (child) is an international subsidiary of the 'end node' (parent) in the jurisdiction of the child

id: LEIEntities.rdf version of this ontology was revised to eliminate deprecated elements.
name: LEIEntities.rdf version of this ontology was revised to eliminate deprecated elements.

id: a transliterated (i.e., in Latin or Romanized ASCII) representation of the abbreviation for the entity legal form
name: a transliterated (i.e., in Latin or Romanized ASCII) representation of the abbreviation for the entity legal form

id: a qualifier indicating that the relationship period reflects the validity period for any regulatory filing, accounting document, other document demonstrating the relationship's validity
name: a qualifier indicating that the relationship period reflects the validity period for any regulatory filing, accounting document, other document demonstrating the relationship's validity

id: indicates that something is limited to or conditional due to some rate or other statistical value
name: indicates that something is limited to or conditional due to some rate or other statistical value

id: a scheme that specifies the elements of an unambiguous legal entity identifier (LEI) scheme to identify the legal entities relevant to any financial transaction
name: a scheme that specifies the elements of an unambiguous legal entity identifier (LEI) scheme to identify the legal entities relevant to any financial transaction

id: indicates that the entity considered the 'end node' or consolidating entity (parent) fully consolidates the accounting of the 'start node' (child) per the accounting rules specified, and is the most distant consolidating entity to that child in any applicable ownership hierarchy
name: indicates that the entity considered the 'end node' or consolidating entity (parent) fully consolidates the accounting of the 'start node' (child) per the accounting rules specified, and is the most distant consolidating entity to that child in any applicable ownership hierarchy

id: a classifier that qualifies something about the relationship between consolidated entities during the reporting period, such as the accounting framework used
name: a classifier that qualifies something about the relationship between consolidated entities during the reporting period, such as the accounting framework used

id: indicates the entity considered the 'end node' or consolidating entity (parent) from an ISO 17442 perspective

name: the set of entity legal form identifiers that comprise the ISO 20275 entity legal form specification

id: LEIEntities.rdf version of this ontology was modified to deprecate LEIEligibleEntity as a part of a simplification strategy for the organizational class hierarchy, to support GLEIF LEI Level 2 ownership relationships, and eliminate a circular dependency with government entities by removing elements that had been deprecated for the last several FIBO revisions (municipal entity, sovereign, and supranational entity).
name: LEIEntities.rdf version of this ontology was modified to deprecate LEIEligibleEntity as a part of a simplification strategy for the organizational class hierarchy, to support GLEIF LEI Level 2 ownership relationships, and eliminate a circular dependency with government entities by removing elements that had been deprecated for the last several FIBO revisions (municipal entity, sovereign, and supranational entity).
